alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 3:40PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Lee, north central Clarendon and central Sumter Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mulberry, or near Sumter, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sumter, Mulberry, Sumter County Airport, Elliott, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Ashwood, Oswego, Dalzell, East Sumter, St. Charles, Cherryvale, Woodrow and Shiloh. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 133 and 142. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
